```{r helper-functions-qho, echo=FALSE}
base_data_dir_4TB <- "/Volumes/SanDisk4TB/SternBrocot"
agg_dir  <- file.path(base_data_dir_4TB, "02_quantum_harmonic_oscillator")
summary_path <- file.path(agg_dir, "02_quantum_harmonic_oscillator.csv.gz")

get_histogram_path <- function(momentum_val) {
  file.path(agg_dir, "histograms", 
             sprintf("histogram_P_%013.6f.csv.gz", momentum_val))
}

# Standardized save function
save_plot <- function(plot_obj, filename, width = 10, height = 6) {
  ggplot2::ggsave(
    filename = file.path(manuscript_dir, filename),
    plot = plot_obj, 
    width = width, 
    height = height,
    device = grDevices::cairo_pdf,
    limitsize = FALSE
  )
}

# Data preparation helper
prepare_plot_data <- function(dt_summary) {
  plot_data <- dt_summary[normalized_momentum > 0.0, .(
    p_val = as.numeric(normalized_momentum), 
    nodes = as.numeric(node_count)
  )]
  plot_data[, is_eigenstate := (floor(p_val / (pi)) == nodes)]
  return(plot_data)
}

# Median selection helper
get_median_by_nodes <- function(dt, node_col = "nodes", p_col = "p_val") {
  data.table::setorderv(dt, c(node_col, p_col))
  dt[dt[, .I[floor((.N+1)/2)], by = node_col]$V1][, 
     .(n = nodes, momentum = p_val)]
}

generate_plot_grid <- function(target_data, plot_title, file_name, show_placeholders = FALSE) {
  cols <- 3
  plot_storage <- vector("list", nrow(target_data))
  
  for (i in seq_len(nrow(target_data))) {
    cur_n <- target_data$n[i]
    cur_p <- target_data$momentum[i]
    
    # Check for approximation flag (backward compatible)
    is_approx <- FALSE
    if ("is_approximation" %in% names(target_data)) {
      is_approx <- isTRUE(target_data$is_approximation[i])
    }

    # Handle missing momentum: instead of 'next', use a blank plot
    if (is.na(cur_p)) {
      plot_storage[[i]] <- ggplot2::ggplot() + 
        ggplot2::theme_void() + 
        ggplot2::labs(title = paste0("n=", cur_n, " (No Data)"))
      next
    }

    f_path <- get_histogram_path(cur_p)

    if (file.exists(f_path)) {
      d_temp <- data.table::fread(f_path)
      h_pts <- d_temp[type == "hist"]
      n_pts <- d_temp[type == "node"]
      bw <- if(nrow(h_pts) > 1) diff(h_pts$x[1:2]) else 0.1

      # Set dynamic color based on approximation status
      accent_color <- if(is_approx) "orange" else "black"
      title_label <- if(is_approx) {
        paste0("n=", cur_n, " (Non-Eigen) | P=", sprintf("%.4f", cur_p))
      } else {
        paste0("n=", cur_n, " | P=", sprintf("%.4f", cur_p))
      }
      plot_storage[[i]] <- ggplot2::ggplot(h_pts, ggplot2::aes(x, y)) +
        ggplot2::geom_col(fill = "black", alpha = 0.25, width = bw) +
        ggplot2::geom_point(data = n_pts, size = 1.2, shape = 16) +
        ggplot2::labs(title = title_label, x = "q", y = "") +
        ggplot2::theme_minimal(base_family = "mono") +
        ggplot2::theme(
          # Change title color and add a border if it's an approximation
          plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(color = accent_color, face = "bold"),
          panel.border = if(is_approx) ggplot2::element_rect(color = "orange", fill = NA, linewidth = 1) 
                         else ggplot2::element_blank()
        )
    } else {
      plot_storage[[i]] <- ggplot2::ggplot() + ggplot2::theme_void() +
                           ggplot2::labs(title = paste("File Missing n=", cur_n))
    }
  }

  combined <- patchwork::wrap_plots(plot_storage, ncol = cols) + 
              patchwork::plot_annotation(
                title = plot_title,
                subtitle = "Note: Orange titles/borders indicate median approximations for missing Schrödinger states",
                theme = ggplot2::theme(plot.subtitle = ggplot2::element_text(color = "orange", face = "italic"))
              )
              
  height_inches <- ceiling(nrow(target_data) / cols) * 3
  save_plot(combined, file_name, width = 10, height = height_inches)
  
  return(list(plot_object = combined, dynamic_height = height_inches))
}

# Physics grid for transitions
generate_physics_grid <- function(jumps_subset) {
  num_jumps <- length(jumps_subset)
  plot_list <- vector("list", num_jumps * 3)
  counter <- 1

  for (j in seq_len(num_jumps)) {
    for (p in seq_along(jumps_subset[[j]]$p_vals)) {
      current_p <- jumps_subset[[j]]$p_vals[p]
      f_path <- get_histogram_path(current_p)

      if (file.exists(f_path)) {
        combined_dt <- data.table::fread(f_path)
        node_label <- as.character(combined_dt$node_count[1])
        hist_data <- combined_dt[type == "hist"]
        node_data <- combined_dt[type == "node"]
        b_width <- if(nrow(hist_data) > 1) diff(hist_data$x[1:2]) else 0.1

        p_obj <- ggplot2::ggplot(hist_data, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +
          ggplot2::geom_vline(xintercept = 0, color = "grey80", linetype = "dashed", linewidth = 0.4) +
          ggplot2::geom_col(fill = "black", alpha = 0.25, width = b_width) +
          ggplot2::geom_step(direction = "hv", color = "black", linewidth = 0.3) +
          ggplot2::geom_point(data = node_data, color = "black", size = 1.2, shape = 16) +
          ggplot2::labs(
            title = paste0(jumps_subset[[j]]$n, " Nodes: ", node_label, " at P = ", sprintf("%.2f", current_p)), 
            x = "q", y = ""
          ) +
          ggplot2::theme_minimal(base_family = "mono") +
          ggplot2::theme(
            plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(size = 9, face = "bold"),
            panel.grid.minor = ggplot2::element_blank()
          )
      } else {
        p_obj <- ggplot2::ggplot() + ggplot2::theme_void() +  
          ggplot2::annotate("text", x = 0.5, y = 0.5, 
                            label = paste("P =", sprintf("%.2f", current_p), "\nmissing"),
                            family = "mono", size = 3)
      }
      
      plot_list[[counter]] <- p_obj
      counter <- counter + 1
    }
  }

  patchwork::wrap_plots(plot_list, ncol = 3) + 
    patchwork::plot_annotation(
      title = "Coordinate Distributions Near Program Length Transitions",
      subtitle = "Automatically Detected Transitions in Median Program Length from Changes in Momentum",
      theme = ggplot2::theme(
        plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold", size = 14, family = "mono"),
        plot.subtitle = ggplot2::element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 10, family = "mono", color = "black")
      )
    )
}
```

```{r jump-detection, echo=F}
dt_summary <- data.table::fread(summary_path)
data.table::setorder(dt_summary, normalized_momentum)
dt_summary <- dt_summary[normalized_momentum > 0.0]

# Convert to numeric to ensure proper calculation
dt_summary[, program_length_median := as.numeric(program_length_median)]

z_diffs <- abs(diff(dt_summary$program_length_median))
threshold <- max(z_diffs, na.rm = TRUE) * 0.0001
jump_indices <- which(z_diffs > threshold)

jumps <- lapply(seq_along(jump_indices), function(i) {
  idx <- jump_indices[i]
  m_at <- dt_summary$normalized_momentum[idx + 1]
  list(
    n = paste("Transition", i),
    p_vals = c(m_at-1, m_at, m_at+1)
  )
})

p_markers <- dt_summary$normalized_momentum[jump_indices]
```

```{r filter-closest-eigenstates, echo=FALSE, fig.width=8, fig.height=6}
# PASS 1: Get exact eigenstates
dt_eigen_raw <- plot_nodes_p[is_eigenstate == TRUE]
dt_eigen_exact <- get_median_by_nodes(dt_eigen_raw)

# Calculate the physical limit based on max momentum (~48 if P=300)
max_p_observed <- max(plot_nodes_p$p_val, na.rm = TRUE)
n_cutoff <- floor(max_p_observed / (pi)) 

# PASS 2: Only consider nodes up to the physical cutoff
all_nodes <- data.table::data.table(n = 0:n_cutoff)

# Identify which nodes are missing within the VALID range
dt_with_exact <- merge(all_nodes, dt_eigen_exact, by = "n", all.x = TRUE)
missing_nodes <- dt_with_exact[is.na(momentum)]$n

# For each missing node, find the closest approximation
dt_closest_approx <- data.table::rbindlist(lapply(missing_nodes, function(node_count) {
  ideal_p <- node_count * pi
  candidates <- plot_nodes_p[nodes == node_count]
  
  if (nrow(candidates) > 0) {
    closest_idx <- which.min(abs(candidates$p_val - ideal_p))
    data.table::data.table(
      n = node_count,
      momentum = candidates$p_val[closest_idx],
      is_approximation = TRUE
    )
  } else {
    data.table::data.table(
      n = node_count,
      momentum = NA_real_,
      is_approximation = TRUE
    )
  }
}))

# Combine exact eigenstates with approximations
dt_eigen_exact[, is_approximation := FALSE]

# For missing nodes, get the median (or lower-middle if even count)
dt_median_approx <- data.table::rbindlist(lapply(missing_nodes, function(node_count) {
  candidates <- plot_nodes_p[nodes == node_count]
  
  if (nrow(candidates) > 0) {
    # Sort by momentum
    data.table::setorder(candidates, p_val)
    
    # Get median index (lower-middle for even count)
    median_idx <- floor((nrow(candidates) + 1) / 2)
    
    data.table::data.table(
      n = node_count,
      momentum = candidates$p_val[median_idx],
      is_approximation = TRUE
    )
  } else {
    data.table::data.table(
      n = node_count,
      momentum = NA_real_,
      is_approximation = TRUE
    )
  }
}))

dt_hybrid_eigenstates <- rbind(
  dt_eigen_exact,
  dt_median_approx,
  fill = TRUE
)
data.table::setorder(dt_hybrid_eigenstates, n)

# Remove any remaining NAs
dt_final <- dt_hybrid_eigenstates[!is.na(momentum)]

# Calculate max nodes safely for plotting
max_nodes_for_plot <- max(plot_nodes_p$nodes, na.rm = TRUE)
if (is.na(max_nodes_for_plot) || !is.finite(max_nodes_for_plot)) {
  max_nodes_for_plot <- max(dt_final$n, na.rm = TRUE)
}

# Visualization
p_momentum_hybrid <- ggplot(plot_nodes_p, aes(x = p_val, y = nodes)) +
  geom_point(color = "grey70", size = 0.2, alpha = 0.4) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = p_markers, color = "grey80", linetype = "dashed", alpha = 0.5) +
  # Exact eigenstates in red
  geom_point(data = dt_final[is_approximation == FALSE], 
             aes(x = momentum, y = n), color = "red", size = 1.5) +
  # Approximations in orange
  geom_point(data = dt_final[is_approximation == TRUE], 
             aes(x = momentum, y = n), color = "orange", size = 1.5, shape = 17) +
  geom_path(data = dt_final, aes(x = momentum, y = n), 
            color = "darkred", linewidth = 0.5, alpha = 0.6) +
  geom_line(data = data.table::data.table(nodes = 0:max_nodes_for_plot, 
                              p_ideal = (0:max_nodes_for_plot) * pi)[
                                p_ideal <= max(plot_nodes_p$p_val, na.rm = TRUE)
                              ],
            aes(x = p_ideal, y = nodes), 
            color = "blue", linetype = "dotted", alpha = 0.5, inherit.aes = FALSE) +
  labs(
    title = latex2exp::TeX("Schrödinger Eigenstates with Median Approximations"),
    subtitle = latex2exp::TeX(paste0(
      "Red circles: Exact eigenstates ($P = \\pi n$) | ",
      "Orange triangles: Median $P$ for missing nodes | ",
      "Blue line: Theoretical $P = \\pi n$"
    )),
    x = latex2exp::TeX("Momentum $P$ ($p/p_0$)"),
    y = latex2exp::TeX("Quantum Number $n$ (Node Count)"),
    caption = "Red: Exact States | Orange: Median (Non-Eigen). | Blue: Ideal Trend | Grey: Full Phase Space"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold", size = 14),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 10, face = "italic"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 11)
  )

print(p_momentum_hybrid)

# Save plot - handle manuscript_dir if it doesn't exist
if (!exists("manuscript_dir")) {
  manuscript_dir <- here::here("manuscript")
  if (!dir.exists(manuscript_dir)) {
    dir.create(manuscript_dir, recursive = TRUE)
  }
}
save_plot(p_momentum_hybrid, "eigenstates.pdf", width = 8, height = 6)

# Create dataset for plotting distributions (including the flag)
dt_hybrid_for_distributions <- data.table::data.table(
  n = dt_final$n, 
  momentum = dt_final$momentum,
  is_approximation = dt_final$is_approximation

  dt_hybrid_for_distributions, 
  "Eigenstate Distributions: Exact States and Median Approximations", 
  "eigen_nodes_hybrid.pdf", 
  show_placeholders = FALSE
)
```

# Ellipse Parameterization (A = PQ)

This visualization shows two overlapping ellipses centered at (0,0) where $A = PQ$. 

```{r experimental_ellipses, fig.width=10, fig.height=3 * length(jumps), echo=FALSE}
ellipse_data <- lapply(jumps, function(j) {
  data.frame(
    transition_name = j$n,
    P_value = j$p_vals,
    Q_value = j$p_vals,
    p_label = factor(sprintf("P = Q = %.2f", j$p_vals), 
                     levels = sprintf("P = Q = %.2f", j$p_vals))
  )
}) %>% bind_rows()

plot_ready <- ellipse_data %>%
  mutate(
    q_radius_x = Q_value,
    q_radius_y = 1/P_value,
    p_radius_x = 1/Q_value,
    p_radius_y = P_value,
    lim = pmax(q_radius_x, p_radius_y) * 1.1 
  ) %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = starts_with("q_radius") | starts_with("p_radius"),
    names_to = c("ellipse_type", ".value"),
    names_pattern = "(.*)_radius_(.*)"
  )

ellipse_plot <- ggplot(plot_ready) +
  geom_ellipse(aes(x0 = 0, y0 = 0, a = x, b = y, angle = 0, 
                   fill = ellipse_type, color = ellipse_type), 
               linewidth = 0.2, alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_blank(aes(x = lim, y = lim)) +
  geom_blank(aes(x = -lim, y = -lim)) +
  facet_wrap(transition_name ~ p_label, scales = "free", ncol = 3) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("q" = "black", "p" = "gray40"),
                    labels = c("q" = "Q", "p" = "P")) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("q" = "black", "p" = "gray40"),
                     labels = c("q" = "Q", "p" = "P")) +
  labs(
    x = "q [q_0]",
    y = "p [p_0]",
    fill = "Conjugate Pair",
    color = "Conjugate Pair",
    title = "Conjugate Quanta of Action",
    subtitle = "LOWER PLATEAU, TRANSITION, UPPER PLATEAU"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    aspect.ratio = 1,
    legend.position = "bottom",
    strip.text = element_text(face = "bold", size = 8)
  )

ellipse_plot

num_transitions <- length(unique(ellipse_data$transition_name))
dynamic_h_ellipse <- num_transitions * 3
save_plot(ellipse_plot, "conjugate_quanta.pdf", width = 10, height = dynamic_h_ellipse)
```
